title.rendered: An open letter to M.S. Dhoni

content.rendered:
Hello Mr Captain Cool,


I grew up seeing your tenacious and finesse cricket as a wicketkeeper-batsman from my cricketing days at school. A lot has to be said but a mighty congratulation to you for being honoured with the prestigious Padma Bhushan award. It’s just “Thank you Dhoni!”. For a man of your prestige, words shall never legitimatize who you are. Your arrival always gives “cricketing- INDIA” hope. It always is awe-inspiring for me to see you in the field. Your ‘work hard-stay dedicated’ approach towards life encourages me towards the best in me. This simplicity of yours makes you a person of unique stature. Belonging to a small town; doing the job of a ticket checker, crushing between the platforms and struggling for the achievement of your goal inspire many young cricketers from small and big cities. I was carried away on the same bandwagon who believed that you were born under the lucky star and good luck drove your success. I am sorry I was wrong. As Vince Lombardi said “Winners never quit and quitters never win”, you’re a set example of the same to me. It has always been one more time and one more opportunity. During setbacks and under-performance; retrospection, observation and calmness were the keys I learnt from you. Your selfless attitude, passion, team spirit, sportsmanship, dedication and the list keep getting longer with more and more values you inculcate; you are a perfect role model for me and many others. You can keep the crowd waiting with bated breath by taking the match to its end and then winning it by hitting a massive beyond the ropes!


Criticism never outraged you. Everyone has haters. But they end up as your fans. Up to this day, I muse on how you manage to stay calm and cool (which you once lost over a teammate); be it on the field as a player or as a spokesperson for the Indian cricket team. I do become sceptical when you bat down the order whereas batting up the order is your forte. The Day: 11/7/2019 (NZ vs IND), social media was flooded with: “That at 5 for 3, 1.25 billion people still believed.” The belief: Dhoni was still to bat and pull the winning shot. But so near yet so far! I had teary eyes. Shattered; by seeing the dismay, you walked to stands and yours not so in-form gameplay. But we, the MSD fans love and idolise you more than ever. Although you’re a sportsman, you are a pro cryptic communicator. It always baffles the opposition team, no matter how hard they try. They never succeed in deciphering especially when you’re behind the stumps. I still dream to master it. Finding an end to your achievements seems to be a wild goose chase. Yes, they’re never-ending. People enjoy your company.” Mahi” is the name by which we all adore you. I wish to rejoice your company of humour, sarcasm viz: – the Australian reporter who questioned your retirement and determination. The way you amuse your daughter Ziva and joke around with the junior teammates, makes me burst out with laughter. Perhaps you are a complete social package off the field.


A grand salute to you for being ranked as the Lieutenant Colonel on November 1, 2011. I would like to hear about this big day whenever I get a chance to meet you. I want to tell you about a common interest we share, it’s the love for bikes. Well, I have the craziness for cars too. Though I could not have them all, posters on the wall and pictures in my gallery exhilarate me. A special request, please give me a visit of your grand collection bike garage.


Down the memory lane, it was the grand day itself when cheeks turned pink and tears of joy, happiness and triumph rolled down from eyes of over 115 crore countrymen just because of your leadership and team efforts; the World Cup was won by India after 28 years. Your unbeaten records till date as a captain and as a player add glory to the Indian cricket. Keep shining with crowning glory because there’s a lot more cricket left in you. The captain was just a title with responsibility, but I feel blessed to have a torchbearer like you leading. Here it comes: “M.S. Dhoni finishes off in style!”.


Yours Sincerely,

An enthusiastic henchman


Vrajal Chokshi

IT 7th Sem
